alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Henry; Madison; Randolph (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 11:42PM EDT until April 01 at 12:30AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Madison County in central Indiana... Delaware County in east central Indiana... Randolph County in east central Indiana... Northern Henry County in east central Indiana... * Until 1230 AM EDT. * At 1142 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Matthews to 7 miles west of Muncie to near Anderson, moving east at 75 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Muncie and Eaton around 1150 PM EDT. Albany, Parker City and Selma around 1155 PM EDT. Farmland, Springport, Prairie Creek Reservoir and Summit Lake State Park around 1200 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Winchester, Ridgeville, Losantville, Blountsville, Union City, Saratoga, Modoc and Lynn. This includes Interstate 69 between mile markers 227 and 252. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for central and east central Indiana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
